intro: Rhabdotheca candolleana, commonly known as the Ceylon thornapple, is a climbing shrub native to southern Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicles containing seeds with tufts of hair. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
